About me how i fell in love with tutoring

My love for it began while studying maths at The University of East Anglia. While there, I worked with a charity to help children from underprivileged backgrounds improve their maths and English.

Watching the growth of these children was incredible and inspired me to pursue this as my job.

I knew if I wanted to make the most impact on a student, it would be in a one-to-one setting. That's because I can change my style to fit the student's needs.

To make the most impact on a student, it would be in a 1-to-1 lesson. I can change my style to fit the student's needs.

And for the last 7 years, I have done that. I've helped students go from grade 3 to grade 7 in their GCSEs.

I have helped A-Level students with their entrance exams to Oxford or Cambridge.

I'm extraordinarily proud of each of my students and go to the best of my ability to give them the support they're seeking.

Please send a message here for more information.

Tutoring Why should I hire a maths coach?

It’s a common belief that you should only hire a tutor if you’re struggling with a subject. And you definitely should not hire a tutor if you’re achieving high results in class!

The trouble with this thinking is that you will cement yourself as an average student. For example, would you have told Rafa Nadal not to hire a tennis coach or Lionel Messi he doesn’t need a manager?

Great athletes understand if they want to achieve the highest results, they need the best coaches and teachers to help them get there.

The same is true of education. If you’re an ambitious student who wants to study at a prestigious university, or maybe you want a high-flying career in the city?

Then these positions are reserved for the best of the best.

To put it bluntly, a grade 9 or an A* is common amongst these applicants. We need to push you beyond, so you can stand out even more.

With my students who decide to follow a stem path, I always push them to be about a year ahead. It’s so that we can focus on picking from the best universities or finding a top apprenticeship.

I’ve done this with all my best-performing students, and they’re now studying maths or economics at universities like Bath, LSE and Imperial.

One has chosen to work for a financial firm in the city - which I can also help with.

I worked with these students providing them with a direct path to take them from great students to elite. And I aim to have completed GCSE maths by year 10.

Once we’ve done that, we can shift our focus to A level for year 11.

It means that we can spend an extra year, which not only puts us in a stronger position for starting maths at A-level but also frees up time for your other two subjects.

It is a lot of work, but the reward is worth it.

Please send a message here for more information.

YouTube Olympiad maths problems

I use these problems to help my highest achieving students.

The Olympiad is a maths event for children in primary and secondary school. Winning can help you get into the best universities like Cambridge and Oxford.

You can also be head-hunted at companies like Jane Street, Two Sigma Investments, or Quora.

Olympiad problems go much further than regular school questions. They make you understand topics more deeply.

Check out my channel for more examples of these problems.
